title: Taliyah's new cast mechanic on W is so frustrating...
body:
You can no longer judge the size of the particle anymore, and the mouse movements feel weird in conjunction with her other abilities.

She isn't placing a line like Viktor/Rumble, and the vector casting that works for them feels wrong on her.

How are other Taliyah players finding it?

(Also I'm pretty sure its impossible to NOT make it throw in a direction now _(at least on smart cast)_ which is a real pain if you're trying to keep them in place for an ashe arrow or other ability.)

<---{{champion:163}}---##

Just jumping in here to provide a bit of context on why it was changed

here was the original post by the champion designer to talk a bit about taliyah after initial release. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/5IpizsoF-taliyah-post-release-follow-up

(The top discussed thing was the W lockout/clunkiness)

Heres the main post talking about why we eventually decided to change the way W worked.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/1bunGEHs-taliyah-changes-for-614

I've taken some excerpts out for you

> Here's the TL;DR: we're switching the W to a vector cast*, removing the spell lockout before eruption, and nerfing the E to go along with those changes.
> 
> First of all, why are we making these changes? It comes down to one very simple thing: using the spell with the constraints I put on it in the interest of game health proved too frustrating for too many people. I made a bet that most players would be able to accept these constraints (particularly the lock-out delay), and I was wrong. So we're changing it!

But yeah I'm no the expert here and you can find full reasoning and context there.

Also @ IndianGamer - "Let’s be clear on one thing: removing this lockout is really powerful (like, Taliyah’s probably crazy as a result). Having witnessed some of the resulting shenanigans during testing, we’re taking pre-emptive measures to soften the best-case of her now much-more-reliable ‘Seismic Shove + Unraveled Earth’ combo. Things might be rocky for a while, but we’re confident that smoother Stoneweaver gameplay paves the road for a balanced Taliyah in the long-term."

By making W Vector instead of having the lock out players are now able to cast W and then E giving their opponents even less time to react to the ability (before you had to cast E first). Because of this increase in strength and reliability of hitting the abillity we had to reduce the damage on the W into E combo.

Hey Lord Sesshomaru!

I can speak to this a little bit. I'm the gameplay designer who worked on Taliyah. It would have been reasonably easy to make a vector cast that allows for knockup if you didn't move your mouse too much, but I was worried about false positives here; I'd need to give the spell some leeway (as in, you never move your mouse exactly 0 units) and that might screw over people who are trying to push enemies in a direction but don't move their mouse too much.  So I'd be worried about that.

But on a higher level, the knockup was very much an artifact of the old cast type. I asked myself "what should happen if the player does not press the button a second time?" and knock up seemed like the safest way to go (I considered knock-away too). Now that that's no longer a thing, I'm happy to not have the knock up on the ability anymore. It makes it clearer to learn playing against Taliyah as well. W will always shove you in a direction; that makes it easier to grok what options she has.

That answer your question?

Hi ZenonTheStoic

Firstly congratulations on Taliyah! I think she is a fantastic champion! Keep up the good work ^^

Ok do i see what you mean about different people having larger or smaller mouse movements, that makes sense. 
Now that you explain why the knock up existed in the first place, i can understand it not being there anymore, i think its a shame that there should be less Variety of options in her kit however (_Much like how Azir over time just keeps losing all his interesting features and utility [Attack Speed CDR passive] [E Knockup] [Ult Duration] [W damage on turrets] etc etc. in favour of just becoming a sheer damage machine, which is so much less fun_) 
Azir is my main with Aurelion Sol and now Taliyah close behind, and i would hate Taliyah to head in Azir's new direction, (so you can understand my hesitation on the removal of the variety on the knock up) but now that you explain it, it puts my fears at bay a little.

I still don't think vector casting was the right move, I believe you were right in the first place, I like many others quickly accepted the lockout and became very fast and accurate with her W and id love to see it return. But I think after all the fuss about changing it to vector, its unlikely it'll be changed back now.

I will always be the first to ask for the old W back (and I'm hopeful theres enough overall feedback to convince you), but if it is 100% not coming back, would there be the possibility of adding a 'particle size' indicator to the new vector cast system? Just having a small directional indcator coming out of nowhere feels weird, it would be great to have a circular indicator (like the old w had on its first cast) from which the directional indicator originates from. 
(_and or, making it so casting it outside of max range causes it to be cast AT max range. instead of making Taliyah path to the position you cast it at in order to make it in range, that would make it so much faster, and be so much less frustrating._)

In any case, thanks so much for taking the time to explain it to me, i really appreciate that!
and congrats again on great work developing The Stoneweaver!
